gep.model

Class ChromosomalArchitecture<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gep.model.ChromosomalArchitecture<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The return parameter type of the GeneElements contained in the created genes of the Chromosomes created by this factory.

    public class ChromosomalArchitecture<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a factory class to create random Chromosomes.
    Author:
    Johannes Wortmann

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChromosomalArchitecture

        public ChromosomalArchitecture()
        Creates a new factory for Chromosomes. Initially the chromosomes don't have any genes.

      • ChromosomalArchitecture

        public ChromosomalArchitecture(java.util.List<Gene<T>> genes)
        Creates a new factory for Chromosomes. Initially the chromosomes contain the given genes.
        Parameters:
        genes - The genes of chromosomes produced by this factory

    • Method Detail

      • addGene

        public int addGene(GeneArchitecture<T> geneArch)
        Adds a gene to the chromosomes produced by this factory.
        Parameters:
        geneArch - The architecture of the gene that should be added to the chromsome.
        Returns:
        The unique geneId that identifies a gene in the chromosomes.

      • addGene

        public int addGene(java.util.List<GeneElement<T>> sequence)
        Adds a gene by its sequence to the chromosomes produced by this factory. The architecture is inferred from the sequence and if the sequence is not long enough it will be padded by terminals in the sequence.
        Parameters:
        sequence - The list of elements that define the genes
        Returns:
        The unique geneId that identifies a gene in the chromosomes.

      • addGene

        public int addGene(Gene<T> gene)
        Adds the given gene to the chromosomes produced by this factory.
        Parameters:
        gene - the gene to be added
        Returns:
        The unique geneId that identifies a gene in the chromosomes.

      • addGenes

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> addGenes(java.util.List<Gene<T>> genes)
        Convenient function that adds all given genes to this architecture and thus to the chromosomes produced by this factory.
        Parameters:
        genes - The list of genes to be added
        Returns:
        A list of gene ids. The order of returned ids matches the order of genes in the given list.

      • setChromosomeRootToGene

        public void setChromosomeRootToGene(Gene<T> rootGene)

        Adds the given gene to the architecture and sets the root of the chromosomes produced by this factory to that given gene. The given gene is not to be allowed to be part of the architecture already. Otherwise the behavior is undefined.The root is the gene of a chromosome from which the evaluation begins.

        Note: The root can just be set once.

        Parameters:
        rootGene - The gene to be set as the root.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the root was already set before.

      • setChromosomeRootToGene

        public void setChromosomeRootToGene(int geneId)

        Sets the root of the chromosomes produced by this factory to the gene defined by the given geneId. The root is the gene of a chromosome from which the evaluation begins.

        Note: The root can just be set once.

        Parameters:
        rootGene - The gene to be set as the root.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the root was already set before.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given geneId is invalid

      • addStaticLinkingFunction

        public void addStaticLinkingFunction(Gene<T> staticLinkingFunction)
        Adds a static linking function to the architecture. This linking function is represented as an unmodifiable gene. Its expression tree defines the linking function.
        Parameters:
        staticLinkingFunction - The unmodifiable gene encoding a static linking function.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given gene is modifiable

      • create

        public Chromosome<T> create()
        Creates a random Chromosome with respect to the possible elements in the architectures genes. The order of the genes will be preserved only the genes itself are randomly created. Convienient method which uses the default random engine.
        Returns:
        A randomly created Chromosome

      • create

        public Chromosome<T> create(RandomEngine r)
        Creates a random Chromosome with respect to the possible elements in the architectures genes. The order of the genes will be preserved only the genes itself are randomly created.
        Parameters:
        r - The random engine to be used for creation.
        Returns:
        A randomly created Chromosome

      • createReplica

        public Chromosome<T> createReplica()
        Creates a chromosome that contains all the genes as they are set in this architecture. This means there will be no random generation of gene sequences. This is only useful if the genes were created by a sequence.
        Returns:
        A chromosome which is an exact replica of all the genes in this architecture.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no modifiable gene exists or the root is not set

      • createSingleGenicChromosome

        public static <T> Chromosome<T> createSingleGenicChromosome(Gene<T> gene)
        Creates a Chromosome that only contains one modifiable Gene and no unmodifiable. To create another kind of Chromosomes use the non static methods of this class.
        Parameters:
        gene - The contained modifiable gene.
